response.answer_text: Mostly. Some were freed and continued to perform in the arena. Lot’s of people killed in the arena weren’t gladiators though. They were just captives, criminals, or other people condemned to die for the entertainment of the crowd. They had no training in fighting. There were some famous celebrity gladiators, most were unknown slaves.

A significant amount of them were slaves, but many were also free and decided to be a gladiator to pay off there debts, others did it because they wanted fame and glory, money etc. But most of them were indeed slaves, being captured by the Romans during battles or sometimes other tribes who were dealing in slaves with the Romans.
